title: Imelda Marcos
author: Tom H.
card_content_html: This image of the personality of Imelda Marcos, the wife of Ferdinand Marcos, who was dictator of the Philippines for over two decades, shows she is outgoing, idealistic, emotional, and optimistic.
card_first_person_html:
Imelda's image is surprisingly a bit like Eleanor Roosevelt's. However, the two had very different ideals and ways of expressing their emotions.

Imelda was content to be someone her impoverished country's poor could look up to, but Eleanor sought to help the poor rise out of their poverty. Also, Imelda focused her emotions on fashion, while Eleanor actually tried to help the less fortunate.
